definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: You agree with us on this point, as indicated in your leaders' proclamations.
sentences.chinese: 这一点，也是你们同意的，见之于你们领导人的文告。

sentences.english: The President signed the instrument of abdication.
sentences.chinese: 总统签署了退位的文告。

sentences.english: The king signed the instrument of abdication.
sentences.chinese: 国王签署了逊位的文告。

sentences.english: Shamil approved the proclamation, signed it and decreed that it should be dispatched to all parts.
sentences.chinese: 沙米利批准文告，并签署命令，应派遣到全国各地。

sentences.english: The declaration was published in August 1687.
sentences.chinese: 宣战的文告是1687年8月公布的。

definition: posting on a bulletin board/notice/bulletin/to announce
a notice to reassure the public/advance notice (of an agenda)
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
(literary) to inform (the public)/to give clear instructions/public announcement (from higher authorities)
imperial bulletin, palace report dating back to Han dynasty
official communication (between gov. offices of equal rank)/report delivered by the head of gov. on affairs of state
